Adidas waits to talk with Dan Carter after drink-driving charge CATHERINE HARRIS Last updated 15:48, February 18 2017 Henry Browne/ Reuters 
Dan Carter, now playing for France's Racing 92, looks dejected after a match against Leicester in October last year. 
Former All Black Dan Carter may have to face the music with sponsors after a drink-driving charge in France this week. 
Carter, who now plays for French team Racing 92, was arrested in Paris on Thursday NZT for driving with an excess blood-alcohol level. 
He wrote on Facebook that he was back in New Zealand on a pre-planned holiday and reflecting on his error. 
Adidas, one of his major sponsors, said it hoped to "catch up with him at some stage". 
READ MORE: 
"We haven't had an opportunity to speak directly with him so until that point we won't be making any other comment," Adidas' global marketing manager in New Zealand, Adam Daysh said. 
Carter's previous sponsorship deals with Philips and heatpump company Daikin appear to have run out. 
Another sponsor, Heatheries, was unable to be contacted, and Carter's manager, Dean Hegan, has not yet responded. 
Earlier this week Carter expressed regret. 
"No excuses - I made a massive error of judgment and have let down my club, my fans and most importantly my family," he wrote on Facebook. Ad Feedback 
"I will have to now let the police/court process run its course and face the consequences. I am just glad no one was harmed. Sorry."
